ResourceHeader.ResourceName: IBEX Energy Neutral Atom Imagers (), Level H3 (H3), Data

RevisionEvent.Note: Initial release of metadata, ADAPT generated, LFB

ResourceHeader.Description: 1: The Interstellar Boundary Explorer (IBEX) has operated in space since 2008 updating our knowledge of the outer heliosphere and its interaction with the local interstellar medium. Start-time: 2008-12-25. There are currently 16 releases of IBEX-HI and/or IBEX-LO data covering 2009-2018. 2: This data set is from the IBEX Data Release 5 - Mariner 10 Hydrogen Ly-alpha backscattered emision and Helium 584A backscattered solar emission from Roll Control Maneuver #7 of Mariner 10. Source of data: Wayne Pryor <Wayne.Pryor@centralaz.edu> and Joe Ajello <joseph.m.ajello@jpl.nasa.gov> Main papers describing scientific results of data: a) Ajello, J.~M., An interpretation of Mariner 10 helium (584 A) and hydrogen (1216 A) interplanetary emission observations, Astrophysical Journal, vol. 222, pp 1068-1079, 1978 doi=10.1086/156224 b) Ajello, J.~M. and Witt, N. and Blum, P.~W., Four UV observations of the interstellar wind by Mariner 10 - Analysis with spherically symmetric solar radiation models, Astrophysical Journal, volume 73, pp260-271, 1979
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement: Please acknowledge the IBEX Mission Principal Investigator, Dr. David J McComas of Princeton University.. The IBEX Release 5 data are archived as fully citable data. Please consult IBEX team publications and personnel for further details on production, processing, and usage of these data.

InformationURL.Name: IBEX The Interstellar Boundary Explorer mission
InformationURL.Description: IBEX Mission, Instrument, and Data Release 5Descriptions

InformationURL.Name: IBEX Data Release 5
InformationURL.Description: IBEX Data Release 5: Hydrogen Ly-alpha backscattered emission and Helium 584A backscattered solar emision from Roll Control Maneuver #7 of Mariner 10. XYZ location of spacecraft during observations in ecliptic coordinates and for the epoch of observation are: -0.500; 0.560; 0.030. See science papers above, and others by same authors

Parameter.Name: Epoch
Parameter.Description: CDF epoch time for the start of the six-month measurement period
Parameter.Caveats: This Parameter exhibits an increasing Monotonic Progression

Parameter.Name: Ecliptic latitude of viewing sightline
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: Epoch
